com.google.ase.terminal
Class TranscriptScreen

java.lang.Object
  com.google.ase.terminal.TranscriptScreen
All Implemented Interfaces:
Screen
public class TranscriptScreen
extends java.lang.Object
implements Screen

A TranscriptScreen is a screen that remembers data that's been scrolled. The old data is stored in a ring buffer to minimize the amount of copying that needs to be done. The transcript does its own drawing, to avoid having to expose its internal data structures.

Constructor Summary
TranscriptScreen(int columns, int totalRows, int screenRows, int foreColor, int backColor)
          Create a transcript screen.

Constructor Detail

TranscriptScreen

public TranscriptScreen(int columns,
                        int totalRows,
                        int screenRows,
                        int foreColor,
                        int backColor)
Create a transcript screen.

Parameters:
columns - the width of the screen in characters.
totalRows - the height of the entire text area, in rows of text.
screenRows - the height of just the screen, not including the transcript that holds lines that have scrolled off the top of the screen.
Method Detail

setLineWrap

public void setLineWrap(int row)
Description copied from interface: Screen
Set line wrap flag for a given row. Affects how lines are logically wrapped when changing screen size or converting to a transcript.

Specified by:
setLineWrap in interface Screen

scroll

public void scroll(int topMargin,
                   int bottomMargin,
                   int foreColor,
                   int backColor)
Scroll the screen down one line. To scroll the whole screen of a 24 line screen, the arguments would be (0, 24).

Specified by:
scroll in interface Screen
Parameters:
topMargin - First line that is scrolled.
bottomMargin - One line after the last line that is scrolled.

blockCopy

public void blockCopy(int sx,
                      int sy,
                      int w,
                      int h,
                      int dx,
                      int dy)
Block copy characters from one position in the screen to another. The two positions can overlap. All characters of the source and destination must be within the bounds of the screen, or else an InvalidParemeterException will be thrown.

Specified by:
blockCopy in interface Screen
Parameters:
sx - source X coordinate
sy - source Y coordinate
w - width
h - height
dx - destination X coordinate
dy - destination Y coordinate

blockSet

public void blockSet(int sx,
                     int sy,
                     int w,
                     int h,
                     int val,
                     int foreColor,
                     int backColor)
Block set characters. All characters must be within the bounds of the screen, or else and InvalidParemeterException will be thrown. Typically this is called with a "val" argument of 32 to clear a block of characters.

Specified by:
blockSet in interface Screen
Parameters:
sx - source X
sy - source Y
w - width
h - height
val - value to set.
foreColor - the foreground color
backColor - the background color

drawText

public final void drawText(int row,
                           Canvas canvas,
                           float x,
                           float y,
                           com.google.ase.terminal.TextRenderer renderer,
                           int cx)
Draw a row of text. Out-of-bounds rows are blank, not errors.

Parameters:
row - The row of text to draw.
canvas - The canvas to draw to.
x - The x coordinate origin of the drawing
y - The y coordinate origin of the drawing
renderer - The renderer to use to draw the text
cx - the cursor X coordinate, -1 means don't draw it
